name: drive
title: Drive API
description: Manages files in Drive including uploading, downloading, searching, detecting changes, and updating sharing permissions.

queryParameters.name: fields
queryParameters.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

queryParameters.name: key
queryParameters.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

queryParameters.name: oauth_token
queryParameters.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

queryParameters.name: prettyPrint
queryParameters.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

queryParameters.name: quotaUser
queryParameters.description: An opaque string that represents a user for quota purposes. Must not exceed 40 characters.

models.description: Information about the user, the user's Drive, and system capabilities.

innerModels.description: A list of themes that are supported for shared drives.

properties.name: backgroundImageLink
properties.description: A link to this theme's background image.

properties.name: colorRgb
properties.description: The color of this theme as an RGB hex string.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of the theme.

innerModels.description: The user's storage quota limits and usage. All fields are measured in bytes.

properties.name: limit
properties.description: The usage limit, if applicable. This will not be present if the user has unlimited storage.

properties.name: usage
properties.description: The total usage across all services.

properties.name: usageInDrive
properties.description: The usage by all files in Google Drive.

properties.name: usageInDriveTrash
properties.description: The usage by trashed files in Google Drive.

properties.name: backgroundImageLink
properties.description: Deprecated - use driveThemes/backgroundImageLink instead.

properties.name: colorRgb
properties.description: Deprecated - use driveThemes/colorRgb instead.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Deprecated - use driveThemes/id instead.

properties.name: appInstalled
properties.description: Whether the user has installed the requesting app.

properties.name: canCreateDrives
properties.description: Whether the user can create shared drives.

properties.name: canCreateTeamDrives
properties.description: Deprecated - use canCreateDrives instead.

properties.name: driveThemes
properties.description: A list of themes that are supported for shared drives.

properties.name: exportFormats
properties.description: A map of source MIME type to possible targets for all supported exports.

properties.name: folderColorPalette
properties.description: The currently supported folder colors as RGB hex strings.

properties.name: importFormats
properties.description: A map of source MIME type to possible targets for all supported imports.

properties.name: kind
properties.description: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string "drive#about".

properties.name: maxImportSizes
properties.description: A map of maximum import sizes by MIME type, in bytes.

properties.name: maxUploadSize
properties.description: The maximum upload size in bytes.

properties.name: storageQuota
properties.description: The user's storage quota limits and usage. All fields are measured in bytes.

properties.name: teamDriveThemes
properties.description: Deprecated - use driveThemes instead.

properties.name: user
properties.description: The authenticated user.

models.description: A change to a file or shared drive.

properties.name: changeType
properties.description: The type of the change. Possible values are file and drive.

properties.name: drive
properties.description: The updated state of the shared drive. Present if the changeType is drive, the user is still a member of the shared drive, and the shared drive has not been deleted.

properties.name: driveId
properties.description: The ID of the shared drive associated with this change.

properties.name: file
properties.description: The updated state of the file. Present if the type is file and the file has not been removed from this list of changes.

properties.name: fileId
properties.description: The ID of the file which has changed.

properties.name: kind
properties.description: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string "drive#change".

properties.name: removed
properties.description: Whether the file or shared drive has been removed from this list of changes, for example by deletion or loss of access.

properties.name: teamDrive
properties.description: Deprecated - use drive instead.

properties.name: teamDriveId
properties.description: Deprecated - use driveId instead.

properties.name: time
properties.description: The time of this change (RFC 3339 date-time).

properties.name: type
properties.description: Deprecated - use changeType instead.

models.description: A list of changes for a user.

properties.name: changes
properties.description: The list of changes. If nextPageToken is populated, then this list may be incomplete and an additional page of results should be fetched.

properties.name: kind
properties.description: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string "drive#changeList".

properties.name: newStartPageToken
properties.description: The starting page token for future changes. This will be present only if the end of the current changes list has been reached.

properties.name: nextPageToken
properties.description: The page token for the next page of changes. This will be absent if the end of the changes list has been reached. If the token is rejected for any reason, it should be discarded, and pagination should be restarted from the first page of results.

models.description: An notification channel used to watch for resource changes.

properties.name: address
properties.description: The address where notifications are delivered for this channel.

properties.name: expiration
properties.description: Date and time of notification channel expiration, expressed as a Unix timestamp, in milliseconds. Optional.

properties.name: id
properties.description: A UUID or similar unique string that identifies this channel.

properties.name: kind
properties.description: Identifies this as a notification channel used to watch for changes to a resource, which is "api#channel".

properties.name: params
properties.description: Additional parameters controlling delivery channel behavior. Optional.

properties.name: payload
properties.description: A bool value to indicate whether payload is wanted. Optional.

properties.name: resourceId
properties.description: An opaque ID that identifies the resource being watched on this channel. Stable across different API versions.

properties.name: resourceUri
properties.description: A version-specific identifier for the watched resource.

properties.name: token
properties.description: An arbitrary string delivered to the target address with each notification delivered over this channel. Optional.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of delivery mechanism used for this channel.

models.description: A comment on a file.

innerModels.description: The file content to which the comment refers, typically within the anchor region. For a text file, for example, this would be the text at the location of the comment.

properties.name: mimeType
properties.description: The MIME type of the quoted content.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The quoted content itself. This is interpreted as plain text if set through the API.

properties.name: anchor
properties.description: A region of the document represented as a JSON string. See anchor documentation for details on how to define and interpret anchor properties.

properties.name: author
properties.description: The author of the comment. The author's email address and permission ID will not be populated.

properties.name: content
properties.description: The plain text content of the comment. This field is used for setting the content, while htmlContent should be displayed.

properties.name: createdTime
properties.description: The time at which the comment was created (RFC 3339 date-time).

properties.name: deleted
properties.description: Whether the comment has been deleted. A deleted comment has no content.

properties.name: htmlContent
properties.description: The content of the comment with HTML formatting.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of the comment.

properties.name: kind
properties.description: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string "drive#comment".

properties.name: modifiedTime
properties.description: The last time the comment or any of its replies was modified (RFC 3339 date-time).

properties.name: quotedFileContent
properties.description: The file content to which the comment refers, typically within the anchor region. For a text file, for example, this would be the text at the location of the comment.

properties.name: replies
properties.description: The full list of replies to the comment in chronological order.

properties.name: resolved
properties.description: Whether the comment has been resolved by one of its replies.

models.description: A list of comments on a file.

properties.name: comments
properties.description: The list of comments. If nextPageToken is populated, then this list may be incomplete and an additional page of results should be fetched.

properties.name: kind
properties.description: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string "drive#commentList".

properties.name: nextPageToken
properties.description: The page token for the next page of comments. This will be absent if the end of the comments list has been reached. If the token is rejected for any reason, it should be discarded, and pagination should be restarted from the first page of results.

models.description: A restriction for accessing the content of the file.

properties.name: readOnly
properties.description: Whether the content of the file is read-only. If a file is read-only, a new revision of the file may not be added, comments may not be added or modified, and the title of the file may not be modified.

properties.name: reason
properties.description: Reason for why the content of the file is restricted. This is only mutable on requests that also set readOnly=true.

properties.name: restrictingUser
properties.description: The user who set the content restriction. Only populated if readOnly is true.

properties.name: restrictionTime
properties.description: The time at which the content restriction was set (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp). Only populated if readOnly is true.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of the content restriction. Currently the only possible value is globalContentRestriction.

models.description: Representation of a shared drive.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of an image file in Google Drive to use for the background image.

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the cropped image in the closed range of 0 to 1. This value represents the width of the cropped image divided by the width of the entire image. The height is computed by applying a width to height aspect ratio of 80 to 9. The resulting image must be at least 1280 pixels wide and 144 pixels high.

properties.name: xCoordinate
properties.description: The X coordinate of the upper left corner of the cropping area in the background image. This is a value in the closed range of 0 to 1. This value represents the horizontal distance from the left side of the entire image to the left side of the cropping area divided by the width of the entire image.

properties.name: yCoordinate
properties.description: The Y coordinate of the upper left corner of the cropping area in the background image. This is a value in the closed range of 0 to 1. This value represents the vertical distance from the top side of the entire image to the top side of the cropping area divided by the height of the entire image.

innerModels.description: Capabilities the current user has on this shared drive.

properties.name: canAddChildren
properties.description: Whether the current user can add children to folders in this shared drive.

properties.name: canChangeCopyRequiresWriterPermissionRestriction
properties.description: Whether the current user can change the copyRequiresWriterPermission restriction of this shared drive.

properties.name: canChangeDomainUsersOnlyRestriction
properties.description: Whether the current user can change the domainUsersOnly restriction of this shared drive.

properties.name: canChangeDriveBackGround
properties.description: Whether the current user can change the background of this shared drive.

properties.name: canChangeDriveMembersOnlyRestriction
properties.description: Whether the current user can change the driveMembersOnly restriction of this shared drive.

properties.name: canComment
properties.description: Whether the current user can comment on files in this shared drive.

properties.name: canCopy
properties.description: Whether the current user can copy files in this shared drive.

properties.name: canDeleteChildren
properties.description: Whether the current user can delete children from folders in this shared drive.

properties.name: canDeleteDrive
properties.description: Whether the current user can delete this shared drive. Attempting to delete the shared drive may still fail if there are untrashed items inside the shared drive.

properties.name: canDownload
properties.description: Whether the current user can download files in this shared drive.

properties.name: canEdit
properties.description: Whether the current user can edit files in this shared drive

properties.name: canListChildren
properties.description: Whether the current user can list the children of folders in this shared drive.

properties.name: canManageMembers
properties.description: Whether the current user can add members to this shared drive or remove them or change their role.

properties.name: canReadRevisions
properties.description: Whether the current user can read the revisions resource of files in this shared drive.

properties.name: canRename
properties.description: Whether the current user can rename files or folders in this shared drive.

properties.name: canRenameDrive
properties.description: Whether the current user can rename this shared drive.

properties.name: canShare
properties.description: Whether the current user can share files or folders in this shared drive.

properties.name: canTrashChildren
properties.description: Whether the current user can trash children from folders in this shared drive.

innerModels.description: A set of restrictions that apply to this shared drive or items inside this shared drive.

properties.name: adminManagedRestrictions
properties.description: Whether administrative privileges on this shared drive are required to modify restrictions.

properties.name: copyRequiresWriterPermission
properties.description: Whether the options to copy, print, or download files inside this shared drive, should be disabled for readers and commenters. When this restriction is set to true, it will override the similarly named field to true for any file inside this shared drive.

properties.name: domainUsersOnly
properties.description: Whether access to this shared drive and items inside this shared drive is restricted to users of the domain to which this shared drive belongs. This restriction may be overridden by other sharing policies controlled outside of this shared drive.

properties.name: driveMembersOnly
properties.description: Whether access to items inside this shared drive is restricted to its members.

properties.name: backgroundImageLink
properties.description: A short-lived link to this shared drive's background image.

properties.name: capabilities
properties.description: Capabilities the current user has on this shared drive.

properties.name: colorRgb
properties.description: The color of this shared drive as an RGB hex string. It can only be set on a drive.drives.update request that does not set themeId.

properties.name: createdTime
properties.description: The time at which the shared drive was created (RFC 3339 date-time).

properties.name: hidden
properties.description: Whether the shared drive is hidden from default view.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of this shared drive which is also the ID of the top level folder of this shared drive.

properties.name: kind
properties.description: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string "drive#drive".

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of this shared drive.

properties.name: restrictions
properties.description: A set of restrictions that apply to this shared drive or items inside this shared drive.

properties.name: themeId
properties.description: The ID of the theme from which the background image and color will be set. The set of possible driveThemes can be retrieved from a drive.about.get response. When not specified on a drive.drives.create request, a random theme is chosen from which the background image and color are set. This is a write-only field; it can only be set on requests that don't set colorRgb or backgroundImageFile.

models.description: A list of shared drives.

properties.name: drives
properties.description: The list of shared drives. If nextPageToken is populated, then this list may be incomplete and an additional page of results should be fetched.

properties.name: kind
properties.description: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string "drive#driveList".

properties.name: nextPageToken
properties.description: The page token for the next page of shared drives. This will be absent if the end of the list has been reached. If the token is rejected for any reason, it should be discarded, and pagination should be restarted from the first page of results.

models.description: The metadata for a file.

innerModels.description: Capabilities the current user has on this shared drive.

properties.name: canAddChildren
properties.description: Whether the current user can add children to this folder. This is always false when the item is not a folder.

properties.name: canAddFolderFromAnotherDrive
properties.description: Whether the current user can add a folder from another drive (different shared drive or My Drive) to this folder. This is false when the item is not a folder. Only populated for items in shared drives.

properties.name: canAddMyDriveParent
properties.description: Whether the current user can add a parent for the item without removing an existing parent in the same request. Not populated for shared drive files.

properties.name: canChangeCopyRequiresWriterPermission
properties.description: Whether the current user can change the copyRequiresWriterPermission restriction of this file.

properties.name: canChangeViewersCanCopyContent
properties.description: Deprecated

properties.name: canComment
properties.description: Whether the current user can comment on this file.

properties.name: canCopy
properties.description: Whether the current user can copy this file. For an item in a shared drive, whether the current user can copy non-folder descendants of this item, or this item itself if it is not a folder.

properties.name: canDelete
properties.description: Whether the current user can delete this file.

properties.name: canDeleteChildren
properties.description: Whether the current user can delete children of this folder. This is false when the item is not a folder. Only populated for items in shared drives.

properties.name: canDownload
properties.description: Whether the current user can download this file.

properties.name: canEdit
properties.description: Whether the current user can edit this file. Other factors may limit the type of changes a user can make to a file. For example, see canChangeCopyRequiresWriterPermission or canModifyContent.

properties.name: canListChildren
properties.description: Whether the current user can list the children of this folder. This is always false when the item is not a folder.

properties.name: canModifyContent
properties.description: Whether the current user can modify the content of this file.

properties.name: canModifyContentRestriction
properties.description: Whether the current user can modify restrictions on content of this file.

properties.name: canMoveChildrenOutOfDrive
properties.description: Whether the current user can move children of this folder outside of the shared drive. This is false when the item is not a folder. Only populated for items in shared drives.

properties.name: canMoveChildrenOutOfTeamDrive
properties.description: Deprecated - use canMoveChildrenOutOfDrive instead.

properties.name: canMoveChildrenWithinDrive
properties.description: Whether the current user can move children of this folder within this drive. This is false when the item is not a folder. Note that a request to move the child may still fail depending on the current user's access to the child and to the destination folder.

properties.name: canMoveChildrenWithinTeamDrive
properties.description: Deprecated - use canMoveChildrenWithinDrive instead.

properties.name: canMoveItemIntoTeamDrive
properties.description: Deprecated - use canMoveItemOutOfDrive instead.

properties.name: canMoveItemOutOfDrive
properties.description: Whether the current user can move this item outside of this drive by changing its parent. Note that a request to change the parent of the item may still fail depending on the new parent that is being added.

properties.name: canMoveItemOutOfTeamDrive
properties.description: Deprecated - use canMoveItemOutOfDrive instead.

properties.name: canMoveItemWithinDrive
properties.description: Whether the current user can move this item within this drive. Note that a request to change the parent of the item may still fail depending on the new parent that is being added and the parent that is being removed.

properties.name: canMoveItemWithinTeamDrive
properties.description: Deprecated - use canMoveItemWithinDrive instead.

properties.name: canMoveTeamDriveItem
properties.description: Deprecated - use canMoveItemWithinDrive or canMoveItemOutOfDrive instead.

properties.name: canReadDrive
properties.description: Whether the current user can read the shared drive to which this file belongs. Only populated for items in shared drives.

properties.name: canReadRevisions
properties.description: Whether the current user can read the revisions resource of this file. For a shared drive item, whether revisions of non-folder descendants of this item, or this item itself if it is not a folder, can be read.

properties.name: canReadTeamDrive
properties.description: Deprecated - use canReadDrive instead.

properties.name: canRemoveChildren
properties.description: Whether the current user can remove children from this folder. This is always false when the item is not a folder. For a folder in a shared drive, use canDeleteChildren or canTrashChildren instead.

properties.name: canRemoveMyDriveParent
properties.description: Whether the current user can remove a parent from the item without adding another parent in the same request. Not populated for shared drive files.

properties.name: canRename
properties.description: Whether the current user can rename this file.

properties.name: canShare
properties.description: Whether the current user can modify the sharing settings for this file.

properties.name: canTrash
properties.description: Whether the current user can move this file to trash.

properties.name: canTrashChildren
properties.description: Whether the current user can trash children of this folder. This is false when the item is not a folder. Only populated for items in shared drives.

properties.name: canTrash
properties.description: Whether the current user can restore this file from trash.

innerModels.description: Additional information about the content of the file. These fields are never populated in responses.

properties.name: image
properties.description: The thumbnail data encoded with URL-safe Base64 (RFC 4648 section 5).

properties.name: mimeType
properties.description: The MIME type of the thumbnail.

innerModels.description: Additional metadata about image media, if available.
Geographic location information stored in the image.

properties.name: altitude
properties.description: The altitude stored in the image.

properties.name: latitude
properties.description: The latitude stored in the image.

properties.name: longitude
properties.description: The longitude stored in the image.

properties.name: aperture
properties.description: The aperture used to create the photo (f-number).

properties.name: cameraMake
properties.description: The make of the camera used to create the photo.

properties.name: cameraModel
properties.description: The model of the camera used to create the photo.

properties.name: colorSpace
properties.description: The color space of the photo.

properties.name: exposureBias
properties.description: The exposure bias of the photo (APEX value).

properties.name: exposureMode
properties.description: The exposure mode used to create the photo.

properties.name: exposureTime
properties.description: The length of the exposure, in seconds.

properties.name: flashUsed
properties.description: Whether a flash was used to create the photo.

properties.name: focalLength
properties.description: The focal length used to create the photo, in millimeters.

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the image in pixels.

properties.name: isoSpeed
properties.description: The ISO speed used to create the photo.

properties.name: lens
properties.description: The lens used to create the photo.

properties.name: location
properties.description: Geographic location information stored in the image.

properties.name: maxApertureValue
properties.description: The smallest f-number of the lens at the focal length used to create the photo (APEX value).

properties.name: meteringMode
properties.description: The metering mode used to create the photo.

properties.name: rotation
properties.description: The number of clockwise 90 degree rotations applied from the image's original orientation.

properties.name: sensor
properties.description: The type of sensor used to create the photo.

properties.name: subjectDistance
properties.description: The distance to the subject of the photo, in meters.

properties.name: time
properties.description: The date and time the photo was taken (EXIF DateTime).

properties.name: whiteBalance
properties.description: The white balance mode used to create the photo.

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the image in pixels.

innerModels.description: Shortcut file details. Only populated for shortcut files, which have the mimeType field set to application/vnd.google-apps.shortcut.

properties.name: targetId
properties.description: The ID of the file that this shortcut points to.

properties.name: targetMimeType
properties.description: The MIME type of the file that this shortcut points to. The value of this field is a snapshot of the target's MIME type, captured when the shortcut is created.

innerModels.description: Additional metadata about video media. This may not be available immediately upon upload.

properties.name: durationMillis
properties.description: The duration of the video in milliseconds.

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the video in pixels.

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the video in pixels.

properties.name: appProperties
properties.description:
A collection of arbitrary key-value pairs which are private to the requesting app.
Entries with null values are cleared in update and copy requests.

properties.name: capabilities
properties.description: Capabilities the current user has on this shared drive.

properties.name: contentHints
properties.description: Additional information about the content of the file. These fields are never populated in responses.

properties.name: contentRestrictions
properties.description: Restrictions for accessing the content of the file. Only populated if such a restriction exists.

properties.name: copyRequiresWriterPermission
properties.description: Whether the options to copy, print, or download this file, should be disabled for readers and commenters.

properties.name: createdTime
properties.description: The time at which the file was created (RFC 3339 date-time).

properties.name: description
properties.description: A short description of the file.

properties.name: driveId
properties.description: ID of the shared drive the file resides in. Only populated for items in shared drives.

properties.name: explicitlyTrashed
properties.description: Whether the file has been explicitly trashed, as opposed to recursively trashed from a parent folder.

properties.name: exportLinks
properties.description: Links for exporting Docs Editors files to specific formats.

properties.name: fileExtension
properties.description: The final component of fullFileExtension. This is only available for files with binary content in Google Drive.

properties.name: folderColorRgb
properties.description:
The color for a folder as an RGB hex string. The supported colors are published in the folderColorPalette field of the About resource.
If an unsupported color is specified, the closest color in the palette will be used instead.

properties.name: fullFileExtension
properties.description:
The full file extension extracted from the name field. May contain multiple concatenated extensions, such as "tar.gz". This is only available for files with binary content in Google Drive.
This is automatically updated when the name field changes, however it is not cleared if the new name does not contain a valid extension.

properties.name: hasAugmentedPermissions
properties.description: Whether there are permissions directly on this file. This field is only populated for items in shared drives.

properties.name: hasThumbnail
properties.description: Whether this file has a thumbnail. This does not indicate whether the requesting app has access to the thumbnail. To check access, look for the presence of the thumbnailLink field.

properties.name: headRevisionId
properties.description: The ID of the file's head revision. This is currently only available for files with binary content in Google Drive.

properties.name: iconLink
properties.description: A static, unauthenticated link to the file's icon.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of the file.

properties.name: imageMediaMetadata
properties.description: Additional metadata about image media, if available.

properties.name: isAppAuthorized
properties.description: Whether the file was created or opened by the requesting app.

properties.name: kind
properties.description: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string "drive#file".

properties.name: lastModifyingUser
properties.description: The last user to modify the file.

properties.name: md5Checksum
properties.description: The MD5 checksum for the content of the file. This is only applicable to files with binary content in Google Drive.

properties.name: mimeType
properties.description:
The MIME type of the file.
Google Drive will attempt to automatically detect an appropriate value from uploaded content if no value is provided. The value cannot be changed unless a new revision is uploaded.
If a file is created with a Google Doc MIME type, the uploaded content will be imported if possible. The supported import formats are published in the About resource.

properties.name: modifiedByMe
properties.description: Whether the file has been modified by this user.

properties.name: modifiedTime
properties.description:
The last time the file was modified by anyone (RFC 3339 date-time).
Note that setting modifiedTime will also update modifiedByMeTime for the user.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the file. This is not necessarily unique within a folder. Note that for immutable items such as the top level folders of shared drives, My Drive root folder, and Application Data folder the name is constant.

properties.name: originalFilename
properties.description: The original filename of the uploaded content if available, or else the original value of the name field. This is only available for files with binary content in Google Drive.

properties.name: ownedByMe
properties.description: Whether the user owns the file. Not populated for items in shared drives.

properties.name: owners
properties.description: The owners of the file. Currently, only certain legacy files may have more than one owner. Not populated for items in shared drives.

properties.name: parents
properties.description:
The IDs of the parent folders which contain the file.
If not specified as part of a create request, the file will be placed directly in the user's My Drive folder. If not specified as part of a copy request, the file will inherit any discoverable parents of the source file. Update requests must use the addParents and removeParents parameters to modify the parents list.

properties.name: permissionIds
properties.description: List of permission IDs for users with access to this file.

properties.name: permissions
properties.description: The full list of permissions for the file. This is only available if the requesting user can share the file. Not populated for items in shared drives.

properties.name: properties
properties.description:
A collection of arbitrary key-value pairs which are visible to all apps.
Entries with null values are cleared in update and copy requests.

properties.name: quotaBytesUsed
properties.description: The number of storage quota bytes used by the file. This includes the head revision as well as previous revisions with keepForever enabled.

properties.name: shared
properties.description: Whether the file has been shared. Not populated for items in shared drives.

properties.name: sharedWithMeTime
properties.description: The time at which the file was shared with the user, if applicable (RFC 3339 date-time).

properties.name: sharingUser
properties.description: The user who shared the file with the requesting user, if applicable.

properties.name: shortcutDetails
properties.description: Shortcut file details. Only populated for shortcut files, which have the mimeType field set to application/vnd.google-apps.shortcut.

properties.name: size
properties.description: The size of the file's content in bytes. This is applicable to binary files in Google Drive and Google Docs files.

properties.name: spaces
properties.description: The list of spaces which contain the file. The currently supported values are 'drive', 'appDataFolder' and 'photos'.

properties.name: starred
properties.description: Whether the user has starred the file.

properties.name: teamDriveId
properties.description: Deprecated - use driveId instead.

properties.name: thumbnailLink
properties.description: A short-lived link to the file's thumbnail, if available. Typically lasts on the order of hours. Only populated when the requesting app can access the file's content. If the file isn't shared publicly, the URL returned in Files.thumbnailLink must be fetched using a credentialed request.

properties.name: thumbnailVersion
properties.description: The thumbnail version for use in thumbnail cache invalidation.

properties.name: trashed
properties.description: Whether the file has been trashed, either explicitly or from a trashed parent folder. Only the owner may trash a file. The trashed item is excluded from all files.list responses returned for any user who does not own the file. However, all users with access to the file can see the trashed item metadata in an API response. All users with access can copy, download, export, and share the file.

properties.name: trashedTime
properties.description: The time that the item was trashed (RFC 3339 date-time). Only populated for items in shared drives.

properties.name: trashingUser
properties.description: If the file has been explicitly trashed, the user who trashed it. Only populated for items in shared drives.

properties.name: version
properties.description: A monotonically increasing version number for the file. This reflects every change made to the file on the server, even those not visible to the user.

properties.name: videoMediaMetadata
properties.description: Additional metadata about video media. This may not be available immediately upon upload.

properties.name: viewedByMe
properties.description: Whether the file has been viewed by this user.

properties.name: viewedByMeTime
properties.description: The last time the file was viewed by the user (RFC 3339 date-time).

properties.name: viewersCanCopyContent
properties.description: Deprecated - use copyRequiresWriterPermission instead.

properties.name: webContentLink
properties.description: A link for downloading the content of the file in a browser. This is only available for files with binary content in Google Drive.

properties.name: webViewLink
properties.description: A link for opening the file in a relevant Google editor or viewer in a browser.

properties.name: writersCanShare
properties.description: Whether users with only writer permission can modify the file's permissions. Not populated for items in shared drives.

models.description: A list of files.

properties.name: files
properties.description: The list of files. If nextPageToken is populated, then this list may be incomplete and an additional page of results should be fetched.

properties.name: incompleteSearch
properties.description: Whether the search process was incomplete. If true, then some search results may be missing, since all documents were not searched. This may occur when searching multiple drives with the "allDrives" corpora, but all corpora could not be searched. When this happens, it is suggested that clients narrow their query by choosing a different corpus such as "user" or "drive".

properties.name: kind
properties.description: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string "drive#fileList".

properties.name: nextPageToken
properties.description: The page token for the next page of files. This will be absent if the end of the files list has been reached. If the token is rejected for any reason, it should be discarded, and pagination should be restarted from the first page of results.

models.description: A list of generated file IDs which can be provided in create requests.

properties.name: ids
properties.description: The IDs generated for the requesting user in the specified space.

properties.name: kind
properties.description: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string "drive#generatedIds".

properties.name: space
properties.description: The type of file that can be created with these IDs.

models.description: A permission for a file. A permission grants a user, group, domain or the world access to a file or a folder hierarchy.

innerModels.description: Details of whether the permissions on this shared drive item are inherited or directly on this item. This is an output-only field which is present only for shared drive items.

properties.name: inherited
properties.description: Whether this permission is inherited. This field is always populated. This is an output-only field.

properties.name: inheritedFrom
properties.description: The ID of the item from which this permission is inherited. This is an output-only field.

properties.name: permissionType
properties.description:
The permission type for this user. While new values may be added in future, the following are currently possible:  
- file 
- member

properties.name: role
properties.description:
The primary role for this user. While new values may be added in the future, the following are currently possible:  
- organizer 
- fileOrganizer 
- writer 
- commenter 
- reader

properties.name: inherited
properties.description: Deprecated - use permissionDetails/inherited instead.

properties.name: inheritedFrom
properties.description: Deprecated - use permissionDetails/inheritedFrom instead.

properties.name: role
properties.description: Deprecated - use permissionDetails/role instead.

properties.name: teamDrivePermissionType
properties.description: Deprecated - use permissionDetails/permissionType instead.

properties.name: allowFileDiscovery
properties.description: Whether the permission allows the file to be discovered through search. This is only applicable for permissions of type domain or anyone.

properties.name: deleted
properties.description: Whether the account associated with this permission has been deleted. This field only pertains to user and group permissions.

properties.name: displayName
properties.description:
The "pretty" name of the value of the permission. The following is a list of examples for each type of permission:  
- user - User's full name, as defined for their Google account, such as "Joe Smith." 
- group - Name of the Google Group, such as "The Company Administrators." 
- domain - String domain name, such as "thecompany.com." 
- anyone - No displayName is present.

properties.name: domain
properties.description: The domain to which this permission refers.

properties.name: emailAddress
properties.description: The email address of the user or group to which this permission refers.

properties.name: expirationTime
properties.description:
The time at which this permission will expire (RFC 3339 date-time). Expiration times have the following restrictions:  
- They can only be set on user and group permissions 
- The time must be in the future 
- The time cannot be more than a year in the future

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of this permission. This is a unique identifier for the grantee, and is published in User resources as permissionId. IDs should be treated as opaque values.

properties.name: kind
properties.description: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string "drive#permission".

properties.name: permissionDetails
properties.description: Details of whether the permissions on this shared drive item are inherited or directly on this item. This is an output-only field which is present only for shared drive items.

properties.name: photoLink
properties.description: A link to the user's profile photo, if available.

properties.name: role
properties.description:
The role granted by this permission. While new values may be supported in the future, the following are currently allowed:  
- owner 
- organizer 
- fileOrganizer 
- writer 
- commenter 
- reader

properties.name: teamDrivePermissionDetails
properties.description: Deprecated - use permissionDetails instead.

properties.name: type
properties.description:
The type of the grantee. Valid values are:  
- user 
- group 
- domain 
- anyone  When creating a permission, if type is user or group, you must provide an emailAddress for the user or group. When type is domain, you must provide a domain. There isn't extra information required for a anyone type.

properties.name: view
properties.description: Indicates the view for this permission. Only populated for permissions that belong to a view. published is the only supported value.

models.description: A list of permissions for a file.

properties.name: kind
properties.description: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string "drive#permissionList".

properties.name: nextPageToken
properties.description: The page token for the next page of permissions. This field will be absent if the end of the permissions list has been reached. If the token is rejected for any reason, it should be discarded, and pagination should be restarted from the first page of results.

properties.name: permissions
properties.description: The list of permissions. If nextPageToken is populated, then this list may be incomplete and an additional page of results should be fetched.

properties.name: action
properties.description:
The action the reply performed to the parent comment. Valid values are:  
- resolve 
- reopen

properties.name: author
properties.description: The author of the reply. The author's email address and permission ID will not be populated.

properties.name: content
properties.description: The plain text content of the reply. This field is used for setting the content, while htmlContent should be displayed. This is required on creates if no action is specified.

properties.name: createdTime
properties.description: The time at which the reply was created (RFC 3339 date-time).

properties.name: deleted
properties.description: Whether the reply has been deleted. A deleted reply has no content.

properties.name: htmlContent
properties.description: The content of the reply with HTML formatting.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of the reply.

properties.name: kind
properties.description: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string "drive#reply".

properties.name: modifiedTime
properties.description: The last time the reply was modified (RFC 3339 date-time).

models.description: A list of replies to a comment on a file.

properties.name: kind
properties.description: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string "drive#replyList".

properties.name: nextPageToken
properties.description: The page token for the next page of replies. This will be absent if the end of the replies list has been reached. If the token is rejected for any reason, it should be discarded, and pagination should be restarted from the first page of results.

properties.name: replies
properties.description: The list of replies. If nextPageToken is populated, then this list may be incomplete and an additional page of results should be fetched.

models.description: The metadata for a revision to a file.

properties.name: exportLinks
properties.description: Links for exporting Docs Editors files to specific formats.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of the revision.

properties.name: keepForever
properties.description:
Whether to keep this revision forever, even if it is no longer the head revision. If not set, the revision will be automatically purged 30 days after newer content is uploaded. This can be set on a maximum of 200 revisions for a file.
This field is only applicable to files with binary content in Drive.

properties.name: kind
properties.description: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string "drive#revision".

properties.name: lastModifyingUser
properties.description: The last user to modify this revision.

properties.name: md5Checksum
properties.description: The MD5 checksum of the revision's content. This is only applicable to files with binary content in Drive.

properties.name: mimeType
properties.description: The MIME type of the revision.

properties.name: modifiedTime
properties.description: The last time the revision was modified (RFC 3339 date-time).

properties.name: originalFilename
properties.description: The original filename used to create this revision. This is only applicable to files with binary content in Drive.

properties.name: publishAuto
properties.description: Whether subsequent revisions will be automatically republished. This is only applicable to Docs Editors files.

properties.name: published
properties.description: Whether this revision is published. This is only applicable to Docs Editors files.

properties.name: publishedLink
properties.description: A link to the published revision. This is only populated for Google Sites files.

properties.name: publishedOutsideDomain
properties.description: Whether this revision is published outside the domain. This is only applicable to Docs Editors files.

properties.name: size
properties.description: The size of the revision's content in bytes. This is only applicable to files with binary content in Drive.

models.description: A list of revisions of a file.

properties.name: kind
properties.description: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string "drive#revisionList".

properties.name: nextPageToken
properties.description: The page token for the next page of revisions. This will be absent if the end of the revisions list has been reached. If the token is rejected for any reason, it should be discarded, and pagination should be restarted from the first page of results.

properties.name: revisions
properties.description: The list of revisions. If nextPageToken is populated, then this list may be incomplete and an additional page of results should be fetched.

properties.name: kind
properties.description: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string "drive#startPageToken".

properties.name: startPageToken
properties.description: The starting page token for listing changes.

models.description: Deprecated: use the drive collection instead.

innerModels.description: An image file and cropping parameters from which a background image for this Team Drive is set. This is a write only field; it can only be set on drive.teamdrives.update requests that don't set themeId. When specified, all fields of the backgroundImageFile must be set.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of an image file in Drive to use for the background image.

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the cropped image in the closed range of 0 to 1. This value represents the width of the cropped image divided by the width of the entire image. The height is computed by applying a width to height aspect ratio of 80 to 9. The resulting image must be at least 1280 pixels wide and 144 pixels high.

properties.name: xCoordinate
properties.description: The X coordinate of the upper left corner of the cropping area in the background image. This is a value in the closed range of 0 to 1. This value represents the horizontal distance from the left side of the entire image to the left side of the cropping area divided by the width of the entire image.

properties.name: yCoordinate
properties.description: The Y coordinate of the upper left corner of the cropping area in the background image. This is a value in the closed range of 0 to 1. This value represents the vertical distance from the top side of the entire image to the top side of the cropping area divided by the height of the entire image.

innerModels.description: Capabilities the current user has on this Team Drive.

properties.name: canAddChildren
properties.description: Whether the current user can add children to folders in this Team Drive.

properties.name: canChangeCopyRequiresWriterPermissionRestriction
properties.description: Whether the current user can change the copyRequiresWriterPermission restriction of this Team Drive.

properties.name: canChangeDomainUsersOnlyRestriction
properties.description: Whether the current user can change the domainUsersOnly restriction of this Team Drive.

properties.name: canChangeTeamDriveBackground
properties.description: Whether the current user can change the background of this Team Drive.

properties.name: canChangeTeamMembersOnlyRestriction
properties.description: Whether the current user can change the teamMembersOnly restriction of this Team Drive.

properties.name: canComment
properties.description: Whether the current user can comment on files in this Team Drive.

properties.name: canCopy
properties.description: Whether the current user can copy files in this Team Drive.

properties.name: canDeleteChildren
properties.description: Whether the current user can delete children from folders in this Team Drive.

properties.name: canDeleteTeamDrive
properties.description: Whether the current user can delete this Team Drive. Attempting to delete the Team Drive may still fail if there are untrashed items inside the Team Drive.

properties.name: canDownload
properties.description: Whether the current user can download files in this Team Drive.

properties.name: canEdit
properties.description: Whether the current user can edit files in this Team Drive

properties.name: canListChildren
properties.description: Whether the current user can list the children of folders in this Team Drive.

properties.name: canManageMembers
properties.description: Whether the current user can add members to this Team Drive or remove them or change their role.

properties.name: canReadRevisions
properties.description: Whether the current user can read the revisions resource of files in this Team Drive.

properties.name: canRemoveChildren
properties.description: Deprecated - use canDeleteChildren or canTrashChildren instead.

properties.name: canRename
properties.description: Whether the current user can rename files or folders in this Team Drive.

properties.name: canRenameTeamDrive
properties.description: Whether the current user can rename this Team Drive.

properties.name: canShare
properties.description: Whether the current user can share files or folders in this Team Drive.

properties.name: canTrashChildren
properties.description: Whether the current user can trash children from folders in this Team Drive.

innerModels.description: A set of restrictions that apply to this Team Drive or items inside this Team Drive.

properties.name: adminManagedRestrictions
properties.description: Whether administrative privileges on this Team Drive are required to modify restrictions.

properties.name: copyRequiresWriterPermission
properties.description: Whether the options to copy, print, or download files inside this Team Drive, should be disabled for readers and commenters. When this restriction is set to true, it will override the similarly named field to true for any file inside this Team Drive.

properties.name: domainUsersOnly
properties.description: Whether access to this Team Drive and items inside this Team Drive is restricted to users of the domain to which this Team Drive belongs. This restriction may be overridden by other sharing policies controlled outside of this Team Drive.

properties.name: teamMembersOnly
properties.description: Whether access to items inside this Team Drive is restricted to members of this Team Drive.

properties.name: backgroundImageFile
properties.description: An image file and cropping parameters from which a background image for this Team Drive is set. This is a write only field; it can only be set on drive.teamdrives.update requests that don't set themeId. When specified, all fields of the backgroundImageFile must be set.

properties.name: backgroundImageLink
properties.description: A short-lived link to this Team Drive's background image.

properties.name: capabilities
properties.description: Capabilities the current user has on this Team Drive.

properties.name: colorRgb
properties.description: The color of this Team Drive as an RGB hex string. It can only be set on a drive.teamdrives.update request that does not set themeId.

properties.name: createdTime
properties.description: The time at which the Team Drive was created (RFC 3339 date-time).

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of this Team Drive which is also the ID of the top level folder of this Team Drive.

properties.name: kind
properties.description: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string "drive#teamDrive".

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of this Team Drive.

properties.name: restrictions
properties.description: A set of restrictions that apply to this Team Drive or items inside this Team Drive.

properties.name: themeId
properties.description: The ID of the theme from which the background image and color will be set. The set of possible teamDriveThemes can be retrieved from a drive.about.get response. When not specified on a drive.teamdrives.create request, a random theme is chosen from which the background image and color are set. This is a write-only field; it can only be set on requests that don't set colorRgb or backgroundImageFile.

models.description: A list of Team Drives.

properties.name: kind
properties.description: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string "drive#teamDriveList".

properties.name: nextPageToken
properties.description: The page token for the next page of Team Drives. This will be absent if the end of the Team Drives list has been reached. If the token is rejected for any reason, it should be discarded, and pagination should be restarted from the first page of results.

properties.name: teamDrives
properties.description: The list of Team Drives. If nextPageToken is populated, then this list may be incomplete and an additional page of results should be fetched.

models.description: Information about a Drive user.

properties.name: displayName
properties.description: A plain text displayable name for this user.

properties.name: emailAddress
properties.description: The email address of the user. This may not be present in certain contexts if the user has not made their email address visible to the requester.

properties.name: kind
properties.description: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string "drive#user".

properties.name: me
properties.description: Whether this user is the requesting user.

properties.name: permissionId
properties.description: The user's ID as visible in Permission resources.

properties.name: photoLink
properties.description: A link to the user's profile photo, if available.

methods.description: Gets information about the user, the user's Drive, and system capabilities.
Gets the starting pageToken for listing future changes.

parameters.name: driveId
parameters.description: The ID of the shared drive for which the starting pageToken for listing future changes from that shared drive is returned.

parameters.name: supportsAllDrives
parameters.description: Whether the requesting application supports both My Drives and shared drives.

parameters.name: supportsTeamDrives
parameters.description: Deprecated use supportsAllDrives instead.

parameters.name: teamDriveId
parameters.description: Deprecated use driveId instead.

methods.description: Lists the changes for a user or shared drive.

parameters.name: driveId
parameters.description: The shared drive from which changes are returned. If specified the change IDs will be reflective of the shared drive; use the combined drive ID and change ID as an identifier.

parameters.name: includeCorpusRemovals
parameters.description: Whether changes should include the file resource if the file is still accessible by the user at the time of the request, even when a file was removed from the list of changes and there will be no further change entries for this file.

parameters.name: includeItemsFromAllDrives
parameters.description: Whether both My Drive and shared drive items should be included in results.

parameters.name: includePermissionsForView
parameters.description: Specifies which additional view's permissions to include in the response. Only 'published' is supported.

parameters.name: includeRemoved
parameters.description: Whether to include changes indicating that items have been removed from the list of changes, for example by deletion or loss of access.

parameters.name: includeTeamDriveItems
parameters.description: Deprecated use includeItemsFromAllDrives instead.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The maximum number of changes to return per page.

parameters.name: restrictToMyDrive
parameters.description: Whether to restrict the results to changes inside the My Drive hierarchy. This omits changes to files such as those in the Application Data folder or shared files which have not been added to My Drive.

parameters.name: spaces
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of spaces to query within the user corpus. Supported values are 'drive', 'appDataFolder' and 'photos'.

parameters.name: supportsAllDrives
parameters.description: Whether the requesting application supports both My Drives and shared drives.

parameters.name: supportsTeamDrives
parameters.description: Deprecated use supportsAllDrives instead.

parameters.name: teamDriveId
parameters.description: Deprecated use driveId instead.

parameterOrder.name: pageToken
parameterOrder.description: The token for continuing a previous list request on the next page. This should be set to the value of 'nextPageToken' from the previous response or to the response from the getStartPageToken method.

methods.description: Subscribes to changes for a user.

parameters.name: driveId
parameters.description: The shared drive from which changes are returned. If specified the change IDs will be reflective of the shared drive; use the combined drive ID and change ID as an identifier.

parameters.name: includeCorpusRemovals
parameters.description: Whether changes should include the file resource if the file is still accessible by the user at the time of the request, even when a file was removed from the list of changes and there will be no further change entries for this file.

parameters.name: includeItemsFromAllDrives
parameters.description: Whether both My Drive and shared drive items should be included in results.

parameters.name: includePermissionsForView
parameters.description: Specifies which additional view's permissions to include in the response. Only 'published' is supported.

parameters.name: includeRemoved
parameters.description: Whether to include changes indicating that items have been removed from the list of changes, for example by deletion or loss of access.

parameters.name: includeTeamDriveItems
parameters.description: Deprecated use includeItemsFromAllDrives instead.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The maximum number of changes to return per page.

parameters.name: restrictToMyDrive
parameters.description: Whether to restrict the results to changes inside the My Drive hierarchy. This omits changes to files such as those in the Application Data folder or shared files which have not been added to My Drive.

parameters.name: spaces
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of spaces to query within the user corpus. Supported values are 'drive', 'appDataFolder' and 'photos'.

parameters.name: supportsAllDrives
parameters.description: Whether the requesting application supports both My Drives and shared drives.

parameters.name: supportsTeamDrives
parameters.description: Deprecated use supportsAllDrives instead.

parameters.name: teamDriveId
parameters.description: Deprecated use driveId instead.

parameterOrder.name: pageToken
parameterOrder.description: The token for continuing a previous list request on the next page. This should be set to the value of 'nextPageToken' from the previous response or to the response from the getStartPageToken method.

methods.description: Stop watching resources through this channel
Creates a new comment on a file.
Deletes a comment.
Gets a comment by ID.

parameters.name: includeDeleted
parameters.description: Whether to return deleted comments. Deleted comments will not include their original content.

methods.description: Lists a file's comments.

parameters.name: includeDeleted
parameters.description: Whether to include deleted comments. Deleted comments will not include their original content.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The maximum number of comments to return per page.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description: The token for continuing a previous list request on the next page. This should be set to the value of 'nextPageToken' from the previous response.

parameters.name: startModifiedTime
parameters.description: The minimum value of 'modifiedTime' for the result comments (RFC 3339 date-time).

methods.description: Updates a comment with patch semantics.
Creates a new shared drive.

parameterOrder.name: requestId
parameterOrder.description: An ID, such as a random UUID, which uniquely identifies this user's request for idempotent creation of a shared drive. A repeated request by the same user and with the same request ID will avoid creating duplicates by attempting to create the same shared drive. If the shared drive already exists a 409 error will be returned.

methods.description: Permanently deletes a shared drive for which the user is an organizer. The shared drive cannot contain any untrashed items.

parameterOrder.name: driveId
parameterOrder.description: The ID of the shared drive.

methods.description: Gets a shared drive's metadata by ID.

parameters.name: useDomainAdminAccess
parameters.description: Issue the request as a domain administrator; if set to true, then the requester will be granted access if they are an administrator of the domain to which the shared drive belongs.

parameterOrder.name: driveId
parameterOrder.description: The ID of the shared drive.

methods.description: Hides a shared drive from the default view.

parameterOrder.name: driveId
parameterOrder.description: The ID of the shared drive.

methods.description: Lists the user's shared drives.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Maximum number of shared drives to return.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description: Page token for shared drives.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Query string for searching shared drives.

parameters.name: useDomainAdminAccess
parameters.description: Issue the request as a domain administrator; if set to true, then all shared drives of the domain in which the requester is an administrator are returned.

methods.description: Restores a shared drive to the default view.

parameterOrder.name: driveId
parameterOrder.description: The ID of the shared drive.

methods.description: Updates the metadate for a shared drive.

parameters.name: useDomainAdminAccess
parameters.description: Issue the request as a domain administrator; if set to true, then the requester will be granted access if they are an administrator of the domain to which the shared drive belongs.

parameterOrder.name: driveId
parameterOrder.description: The ID of the shared drive.

methods.description: Creates a copy of a file and applies any requested updates with patch semantics. Folders cannot be copied.

parameters.name: enforceSingleParent
parameters.description: Deprecated. Copying files into multiple folders is no longer supported. Use shortcuts instead.

parameters.name: ignoreDefaultVisibility
parameters.description: Whether to ignore the domain's default visibility settings for the created file. Domain administrators can choose to make all uploaded files visible to the domain by default; this parameter bypasses that behavior for the request. Permissions are still inherited from parent folders.

parameters.name: includePermissionsForView
parameters.description: Specifies which additional view's permissions to include in the response. Only 'published' is supported.

parameters.name: keepRevisionForever
parameters.description: Whether to set the 'keepForever' field in the new head revision. This is only applicable to files with binary content in Google Drive. Only 200 revisions for the file can be kept forever. If the limit is reached, try deleting pinned revisions.

parameters.name: ocrLanguage
parameters.description: A language hint for OCR processing during image import (ISO 639-1 code).

parameters.name: supportsAllDrives
parameters.description: Whether the requesting application supports both My Drives and shared drives.

parameters.name: supportsTeamDrives
parameters.description: Deprecated use supportsAllDrives instead.

methods.description: Creates a new file.

parameters.name: enforceSingleParent
parameters.description: Deprecated. Creating files in multiple folders is no longer supported.

parameters.name: ignoreDefaultVisibility
parameters.description: Whether to ignore the domain's default visibility settings for the created file. Domain administrators can choose to make all uploaded files visible to the domain by default; this parameter bypasses that behavior for the request. Permissions are still inherited from parent folders.

parameters.name: includePermissionsForView
parameters.description: Specifies which additional view's permissions to include in the response. Only 'published' is supported.

parameters.name: keepRevisionForever
parameters.description: Whether to set the 'keepForever' field in the new head revision. This is only applicable to files with binary content in Google Drive. Only 200 revisions for the file can be kept forever. If the limit is reached, try deleting pinned revisions.

parameters.name: ocrLanguage
parameters.description: A language hint for OCR processing during image import (ISO 639-1 code).

parameters.name: supportsAllDrives
parameters.description: Whether the requesting application supports both My Drives and shared drives.

parameters.name: supportsTeamDrives
parameters.description: Deprecated use supportsAllDrives instead.

parameters.name: useContentAsIndexableText
parameters.description: Whether to use the uploaded content as indexable text.

methods.description: Permanently deletes a file owned by the user without moving it to the trash. If the file belongs to a shared drive the user must be an organizer on the parent. If the target is a folder, all descendants owned by the user are also deleted.

parameters.name: enforceSingleParent
parameters.description: Deprecated. If an item is not in a shared drive and its last parent is deleted but the item itself is not, the item will be placed under its owner's root.

parameters.name: supportsAllDrives
parameters.description: Whether the requesting application supports both My Drives and shared drives.

parameters.name: supportsTeamDrives
parameters.description: Deprecated use supportsAllDrives instead.

methods.description: Permanently deletes all of the user's trashed files.

parameters.name: enforceSingleParent
parameters.description: Deprecated. If an item is not in a shared drive and its last parent is deleted but the item itself is not, the item will be placed under its owner's root.

methods.description: Exports a Google Doc to the requested MIME type and returns the exported content. Please note that the exported content is limited to 10MB.

parameterOrder.name: mimeType
parameterOrder.description: The MIME type of the format requested for this export.

methods.description: Generates a set of file IDs which can be provided in create or copy requests.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of IDs to return.

parameters.name: space
parameters.description: The space in which the IDs can be used to create new files. Supported values are 'drive' and 'appDataFolder'.

methods.description: Gets a file's metadata or content by ID.

parameters.name: acknowledgeAbuse
parameters.description: Whether the user is acknowledging the risk of downloading known malware or other abusive files. This is only applicable when alt=media.

parameters.name: includePermissionsForView
parameters.description: Specifies which additional view's permissions to include in the response. Only 'published' is supported.

parameters.name: supportsAllDrives
parameters.description: Whether the requesting application supports both My Drives and shared drives.

parameters.name: supportsTeamDrives
parameters.description: Deprecated use supportsAllDrives instead.

methods.description: Lists or searches files.

parameters.name: corpora
parameters.description: Groupings of files to which the query applies. Supported groupings are: 'user' (files created by, opened by, or shared directly with the user), 'drive' (files in the specified shared drive as indicated by the 'driveId'), 'domain' (files shared to the user's domain), and 'allDrives' (A combination of 'user' and 'drive' for all drives where the user is a member). When able, use 'user' or 'drive', instead of 'allDrives', for efficiency.

parameters.name: corpus
parameters.description: The source of files to list. Deprecated: use 'corpora' instead.

parameters.name: driveId
parameters.description: ID of the shared drive to search.

parameters.name: includeItemsFromAllDrives
parameters.description: Whether both My Drive and shared drive items should be included in results.

parameters.name: includePermissionsForView
parameters.description: Specifies which additional view's permissions to include in the response. Only 'published' is supported.

parameters.name: includeTeamDriveItems
parameters.description: Deprecated use includeItemsFromAllDrives instead.

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of sort keys. Valid keys are 'createdTime', 'folder', 'modifiedByMeTime', 'modifiedTime', 'name', 'name_natural', 'quotaBytesUsed', 'recency', 'sharedWithMeTime', 'starred', and 'viewedByMeTime'. Each key sorts ascending by default, but may be reversed with the 'desc' modifier. Example usage: ?orderBy=folder,modifiedTime desc,name. Please note that there is a current limitation for users with approximately one million files in which the requested sort order is ignored.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The maximum number of files to return per page. Partial or empty result pages are possible even before the end of the files list has been reached.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description: The token for continuing a previous list request on the next page. This should be set to the value of 'nextPageToken' from the previous response.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: A query for filtering the file results. See the "Search for Files" guide for supported syntax.

parameters.name: spaces
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of spaces to query within the corpus. Supported values are 'drive', 'appDataFolder' and 'photos'.

parameters.name: supportsAllDrives
parameters.description: Whether the requesting application supports both My Drives and shared drives.

parameters.name: supportsTeamDrives
parameters.description: Deprecated use supportsAllDrives instead.

parameters.name: teamDriveId
parameters.description: Deprecated use driveId instead.

methods.description: Updates a file's metadata and/or content. This method supports patch semantics.

parameters.name: addParents
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of parent IDs to add.

parameters.name: enforceSingleParent
parameters.description: Deprecated. Adding files to multiple folders is no longer supported. Use shortcuts instead.

parameters.name: includePermissionsForView
parameters.description: Specifies which additional view's permissions to include in the response. Only 'published' is supported.

parameters.name: keepRevisionForever
parameters.description: Whether to set the 'keepForever' field in the new head revision. This is only applicable to files with binary content in Google Drive. Only 200 revisions for the file can be kept forever. If the limit is reached, try deleting pinned revisions.

parameters.name: ocrLanguage
parameters.description: A language hint for OCR processing during image import (ISO 639-1 code).

parameters.name: removeParents
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of parent IDs to remove.

parameters.name: supportsAllDrives
parameters.description: Whether the requesting application supports both My Drives and shared drives.

parameters.name: supportsTeamDrives
parameters.description: Deprecated use supportsAllDrives instead.

parameters.name: useContentAsIndexableText
parameters.description: Whether to use the uploaded content as indexable text.

methods.description: Subscribes to changes to a file

parameters.name: acknowledgeAbuse
parameters.description: Whether the user is acknowledging the risk of downloading known malware or other abusive files. This is only applicable when alt=media.

parameters.name: includePermissionsForView
parameters.description: Specifies which additional view's permissions to include in the response. Only 'published' is supported.

parameters.name: supportsAllDrives
parameters.description: Whether the requesting application supports both My Drives and shared drives.

parameters.name: supportsTeamDrives
parameters.description: Deprecated use supportsAllDrives instead.

methods.description: Creates a permission for a file or shared drive.

parameters.name: emailMessage
parameters.description: A plain text custom message to include in the notification email.

parameters.name: enforceSingleParent
parameters.description: Deprecated. See moveToNewOwnersRoot for details.

parameters.name: moveToNewOwnersRoot
parameters.description: This parameter will only take effect if the item is not in a shared drive and the request is attempting to transfer the ownership of the item. If set to true, the item will be moved to the new owner's My Drive root folder and all prior parents removed. If set to false, parents are not changed.

parameters.name: sendNotificationEmail
parameters.description: Whether to send a notification email when sharing to users or groups. This defaults to true for users and groups, and is not allowed for other requests. It must not be disabled for ownership transfers.

parameters.name: supportsAllDrives
parameters.description: Whether the requesting application supports both My Drives and shared drives.

parameters.name: supportsTeamDrives
parameters.description: Deprecated use supportsAllDrives instead.

parameters.name: transferOwnership
parameters.description: Whether to transfer ownership to the specified user and downgrade the current owner to a writer. This parameter is required as an acknowledgement of the side effect.

parameters.name: useDomainAdminAccess
parameters.description: Issue the request as a domain administrator; if set to true, then the requester will be granted access if the file ID parameter refers to a shared drive and the requester is an administrator of the domain to which the shared drive belongs.
